Hello javainsel,

Am Samstag=
, 26. April 2003 10:46 schrieb javainsel:
> Today I downloaded "Java(TM) 2 =
SDK, Standard Edition (SCSL) 1.4.1"
> from Sun: http://wwws.sun.com/softwar=
e/java2/download.html
>
> It includes the sources, tests and makefiles whic=
h are not included
> in the Java SDK 1.4.1.
>
> When I unpacked the archive=
 which I've downloaded, I discovered that
> Sun doesn't use JUnit. They hav=
e custom test classes which are not
> automated like JUnit tests.
>
> Besid=
es this they don't use Ant. They have some kind of makefiles
> instead.
>
>=
 What do you think about it?

They don't use JUnit because they had to writ=
e their tests before Junit 
existed. On the other hand, the number of regre=
ssion bugs regularly showing 
up in Java shows that there is some room for =
improvement in the way SUN are 
doing their testing.

They don't use Ant fo=
r the JDK because they had to automize the JDK build long 
before Ant exist=
ed.

If you take a lok at other APIs from SUN, you will see they actually d=
o use 
Ant, they just don't use it for the SDK SE yet.


Bye
